alert.note: Alert for Laramie Valley; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 2:25PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Albany and northwestern Laramie Counties through 300 PM MDT... At 224 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles west of Horse Creek, or 15 miles northeast of Laramie, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... North Crow Campground and Horse Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Laramie Valley; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills
